problems.title: Vacuum won't pick up dirt / Low Suction
problems.description: The vacuum is running but pushing dirt around or has very weak suction.
possible_causes: Clog in the foot or nozzle
solution_steps: Remove the filter and wash it with warm water. Let it air dry for 24 hours.
Check the nozzle opening on the foot for clogs.
Ensure the dirt cup is properly locked into place.

problems.title: Dirt Cup won't stay attached (Latch Broken)
problems.description: The bottom dirt container falls off or the release latch is snapped.
solution_steps: Inspect the plastic latch on the dirt cup.
If broken, the entire dirt cup usually needs to be replaced (it's very cheap).

problems.title: Vacuum shuts off while using
problems.description: The unit gets hot and turns off suddenly.
possible_causes: Thermal protector activated due to overheating
solution_steps: Check and clean the filter (this is the #1 cause).
Let the motor cool down for at least 30 minutes before restarting.
